medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive worsening of fine and gross motor skills.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately one year prior to the visit with increasing clumsiness and frequent falls. Initially presented to the ophthalmology clinic after failing a vision screening test. The visual acuity decreased from 20/150 to 20/400 bilaterally over the course of 13 months, with the introduction of horizontal nystagmus.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a diagnosis of Brown-Vialetto-Van Laere syndrome confirmed by genetic testing with compound heterozygous variants in SLC52A2.
medical_history.family_history: The patient has one healthy 4-year-old brother who carries the same genetic variants and exhibited mild symptoms.
